--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> Well! That was an excellent post, but I'm not sure how you got 
added 
> to the yahoogroup. I guess Rudrak or Azure must have added you 
> though... otherwise I have no clue.
> 
> The only thing that's wrong about this is the bio, Transformer 
stats 
> generally go on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the highest 
(although, 
> if you were to explain how your grading system worked, then it 
> wouldn't matter). You should check out some of the bio's on the 
> website for something to relate too.
> 
> The thing you need to do right now, is to go to the NBWRPG 
website, 
> and check out the how to join section. http://www.nbwrpg.com/
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "raccoon7679" <raccoon7679@y...> wrote:
> > Name: Smidgen
> > Bot Type: Kit Fox
> > Faction: Maximal
> > Height: 4'6"
> > Weight: 90lbs
> > Strength: 17
> > Speed:15
> > Intelegence:16
> > Wisdom:14
> > Charisma:18
> > Weapons: 1 Plasma Pistol, 1 Engeron Sword, 1 Energon Shield
> > Natural Weapons: Teeth, Claws
> > Special Training:
> > 
> > OOC:  Uh, if I mess this up, someone please let me know.  I'm 
> taking 
> > a leap of faith and hoping I'm doing this right. Or at least in 
a 
> > semi-acceptable form. 
> > 
> > Smidgen:
> > During a routine flight on a small cargo vessel, the 
StarSkipper, 
> > things appeared normal.  Smidgen was piloting the small craft 
from 
> a 
> > moon 97 light years from her home world Tinkitry.  The ship was 
> > carring the latest shipment of energon that had been mined from 
> the 
> > moon. It may not have seemed like a lot, but it would have 
> supplied 
> > power to more than 80 cities for a year.  Energon mining was a 
> very 
> > slow proccess.  It took the miners 8 months to mine this much. 
> > Smidgen sat back and rested her small feet on the console.  She 
> > yawned and put her hands behind her head. "Yeah, this is the 
> life.  
> > No worries. No hurries.  Nothing to do but die of  bordom and 
wait 
> > untill my application for the HonorGuard to be accepted."  The 
> > HOnorGuard was an elite fighting group.  They protected the 
> capital 
> > and those in power.  She had always dreamed of being a  guard 
when 
> > she was a little bot.  But for now she would have to wait 
> > patiently.  Although patients wasn't her strongsuit, she tried 
to 
> > remain calm. The long and boring flight was taking it's toll.  
> Cargo 
> > ships weren't known for thier speed.   She was about to put the 
> ship 
> > on AUTO PILOT when the ship shook violantly.  She regained 
control 
> > of the helm and checked her instruments.  A hole in spacec 
> appeared 
> > off her port bow.  "I thought black holes were supposed to be so 
> > black that you couldn't even see them?"  She felt the ship being 
> > pulled towards the hole.  She was being forced up against the 
> inside 
> > of her chair by the g-forces as the ship was being sucked 
> > in.  "DAMN! Got....to...get this...puppy out...of here."  SHe 
> bould 
> > feel herself starting to black out. She reached up and hit the 
> auto 
> > pilot button, but the force of the hole was too great. The ship 
> sped 
> > up and slipped into the hole.  For Smidgen, there was 
darkness.   
> > 
> > She awoke still in the chair of the ship.  She rubbed her optics 
> and 
> > looked around.  Sitting forward, she tried to regain power and 
> > control over the ships systems.  Nothing worked. "Oh just 
swell.  
> > How am I going to make my delivery on time now Huh?"
> > 
> > She looked out the front windows and noticed that there were 
> > branches sticking through the shield.  She got up out of the 
chair 
> > and walked to the back to check on the cargo.  The ship rocked 
> back 
> > and forth as she walked the length of the small ship.   "Uh, 
that 
> > doesn't feel right." She walked back to the front and looked out 
> the 
> > window.  It dawned on her that the ship was stuck in a giant 
tree. 
> > She estimated she was about 100 feet up or so.  She swallowed 
hard 
> > and very slowly sat down in her chair. " Oh boy. Now what?"  She 
> > carefully reached over to a small red panel in the middle of the 
> > console.  Pressing a red button, she activated the 
distress/homing 
> > beacon on the ship.  With luck, her friends would find her soon 
> and 
> > she'd be able to get the shipment to it's destination. "Heh, 
> better 
> > late than never I guess. At least I'm in one piece. But where 
the 
> > heck am I?"
